MajorClaims.MC1: giving those with no work a mobile phone each is a total waste of money
MajorClaims.MC2: providing those who are jobless with mobile phones that are accessible to internet is not a proper and the best way to trim down the rate of unemployment

Claims.C1: if the government provides those without work with a mobile phone, they will be able to find themselves an occupation in order to live and survive
Claims.C2: the money can be used for other intentions rather than giving hand phones to the unemployed
Claims.C3: when hand phones are provided for free, many would want to take advantage of this opportunity
Claims.C4: till now, there are no surveys or evidences that prove this method in effective in reducing the rate of unemployment

Premises.P1: when people without jobs have hand phones that have access to the Internet, they will be able to browse the net for more job opportunities
Premises.P2: they can surf the The Star Onlines' work section to find a job that is suitable for them
Premises.P3: With the help of the net, they can also do more research on the work that they have found apart from looking up on how they can prepare themselves for the job
Premises.P4: the mobile phones can also be used to make calls with the companies in which they would like to work with
Premises.P5: supplying hand phones to the unemployed is a waste of the taxpayers' money
Premises.P6: the money instead of being used to supply the electronic gadget can be used for other useful purposes for the country
Premises.P7: the money can be used to build more amenities for the public or given to the poor so that they can use it to help them earn a living
Premises.P8: It will not be surprising that in order to obtain a mobile phone, they make themselves jobless
Premises.P9: Some might even go to the extent of lying that they are on unemployment to make them eligible to get the phones
Premises.P10: the public's money is spent worthlessly
